Package org.zaproxy.zap.extension.anticsrf

Class ExtensionAntiCSRF

java.lang.Object
org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionAdaptor
org.zaproxy.zap.extension.anticsrf.ExtensionAntiCSRF
All Implemented Interfaces:
Extension, SessionChangedListener
public class ExtensionAntiCSRF extends ExtensionAdaptor implements SessionChangedListener
An Extension that handles anti-csrf tokens.

Extracts and tracks anti-csrf tokens, allowing to refresh and send them in new requests.

Since:
1.3.0

    • unload

      public void unload()
      Description copied from class: ExtensionAdaptor
      Unloads any component manually added to ZAP or other extensions (that is, a component that was not added through the ExtensionHook).

      Should be called only by core functionality (e.g. during uninstallation of the extension).

      Does nothing by default.

      Specified by:
      unload in interface Extension
      Overrides:
      unload in class ExtensionAdaptor
      See Also:
      • Extension.hook(ExtensionHook)

    • addAntiCsrfTokenName

      public void addAntiCsrfTokenName(String token)
      Adds the given token name, enabled by default.

      The call to this method has no effect if the given name is null or empty, or a token with the given name already exist.

      Parameters:
      token - the token name to add.
      Since:
      1.4.0
      See Also:
      • removeAntiCsrfTokenName(String)
      • getAntiCsrfTokenNames()

    • removeAntiCsrfTokenName

      public void removeAntiCsrfTokenName(String token)
      Removes the given token name.

      The call to this method has no effect if the given name is null or empty, or if the token with the given name does not exist.

      Parameters:
      token - the token name to remove.
      Since:
      1.4.0
      See Also:
      • addAntiCsrfTokenName(String)

    • getTokensFromResponse

      public List<AntiCsrfToken> getTokensFromResponse(HttpMessage msg)
      Convenience method that calls getTokensFromResponse(HttpMessage, Source) with a Source built from the response of the given HTTP message.
      Parameters:
      msg - from where the tokens should be extracted.
      Returns:
      the extracted anti-csrf tokens.
      Since:
      2.8.0

    • getTokensFromResponse

      Gets the known anti-csrf tokens from the given response.
      Parameters:
      msg - from where the tokens should be extracted.
      source - the HTML source document of the response.
      Returns:
      the extracted anti-csrf tokens.
      Since:
      2.2.0

    • generateForm

      public String generateForm(HttpMessage msg) throws UnsupportedEncodingException
      Generates a HTML form from the given message.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message used to generate the HTML form, must not be null.
      Returns:
      a string containing the HTML form, never null.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException - if an error occurred while encoding the values of the form.
      Since:
      2.7.0

    • regenerateAntiCsrfToken

      public void regenerateAntiCsrfToken(HttpMessage message, HttpMessageSender httpSender)
      Regenerates the AntiCsrfToken of a HttpMessage if one exists to obtain the new AntiCsrfToken.
      Parameters:
      message - The HttpMessage to be checked.
      httpSender - The sendAndReceive implementation of the caller.
      Since:
      2.10.0
